newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee closes low on dollar strength.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee closes low on dollar strength.

text.p: The Sri Lanka rupee fell against the dollar on Thursday mainly on the greenback's overseas strength, dealers said.
The rupee closed at 59.30 against the U.S. currency after opening at 59.20 and falling to 59.33 in early trade, dealers said.
The Central Bank pushed up the dollar by three local cents, mainly on gains against sterling and fixed buying and selling prices at 58.2219 and 59.3981.
"The Central Bank action pushed down the rupee, but it recovered somewhat after people began selling dollars," a foreign bank dealer said.
"It looks like sellers are in the market," a dealer for Standard Chartered Bank said.
"Those who carry (dollar) plus positions fear the dollar will come down, since it has been trading at the top for over a month. They are trying to liquidate," he said.
Overnight call money rates closed at 9.50 percent after opening at about the same level, dealers said.
